We are excited to see our student-athletes back in action and together, and it is up to all of us to make sure it stays that way. Typically, we would like to have as many fans in attendance as possible to support our athletes, cheerleaders and band members, however the governorâ€™s guidance limits our allowable capacity at all athletic event locations.

As a reminder, spectator attendance is capped at 15% of venue capacity for both home and away fans, and families of the participants from both teams are the first priority for seating at athletic events. All tickets will be presale. There will be no tickets sold at events.

The order prohibits temporary seating of any kind (such as additionalâ€¦

Today, Thursday, July 2, 2020, Governor DeWine announced back to school health and safety guidelines for all school districts across Ohio. Marion City Schools is currently reviewing those guidelines.

Our school district has been planning and preparing for multiple scenarios to safely welcome students and staff back.

We will be reviewing the latest information from the governor, so we can meet the requirements set forth in these guidelines. Once we know more, we will share more details. #WeRPrexies

Marion Ohio Rotary Club
May 26 at 1:47 PM Â·

Today we had another great meeting (Via Zoom)! We heard from Johnnie Jackson, Diversity and Equity Supervisor at Marion City Schools who shared with Rotarians the importance of investing in our youth - particularly those of color. Johnnie pointed out that this is not only important as Marionites but as Rotarians.

post_text:
We have received notice from Marion Public Health that the Friday Night Lights event involving turning on football stadium lights throughout Marion County violates the Stay at Home Order set forth by the Ohio Department of Health on April 2, 2020, and cannot be allowed to continue. Like you, we are deeply disappointed, and we were looking forward to the celebration. However, we understand that the safety of our fellow neighbors must come first. Our current situation in Marion - the increase in community cases being seen due to the outbreak of COVID19 in the prison and the vulnerability of our population to another outbreak - puts Marion County at increased risk right now. We must be vigilant and not create any unnecessary risks.

Although it will not happen as we all had hoped, we still plan to celebrate. We encourage all Marion County residents to still turn their porch lights on at 8:20 pm for 20 minutes tomorrow night to show support for the members of the Class of 2020. #WeRPrexies

post_text:
*** Update Thursday, April 2, 2020 ***

Did you know? Our county ADAMH board continues to offer support for students in crisis in Marion county. Many students feel comfort in having regular interaction with school staff, and may now be struggling with the changes in their environment due to COVID-19.

Any parent/legal guardian of a student in Marion County is encouraged to call Marion Area Counseling Center (MACC) if their child is struggling or in crisis. Contact April Smith at (740) 387-5210 for additional information about an initial consultation, which could be at no cost to the family. The initial consultation can be completed by phone or at MACC. Donâ€™t hesitate to reach out!

For additional updates on our website, follow â†ªï¸ https://tinyurl.com/ss2enal. #WeRPrexies

ğŸ“£ Open enrollment for the 2020-2021 school year starts tomorrow, April 1. Applications will be accepted through Monday, June 1. Students who want to change school buildings or school districts must apply for open enrollment.

Marion City Schools offers two types of open enrollment:

â€£ intra-district open enrollment - from one Marion City School building to another (click here to download an application - https://tinyurl.com/wzemw7y)

â€£ inter-district open enrollment - from another school district into Marion City School District (click here to download an application - https://tinyurl.com/u7bepsb)

It is preferred that completed open enrollment applications be mailed to the Student Enrollment Center located at 100 Executive Dr., Marion, OH 43302, but families can also return applications to a lockbox at the Student Enrollment Center. #WeRPrexies

***** Special Update *****

Per Governor Mike DeWineâ€™s announcement this afternoon, Ohio schools will continue remote learning through May 1, 2020 in response to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. We want to take this opportunity to thank our entire staff for their hard work, and all of our families for their ongoing support. We will be releasing information this week regarding the emergency meal distribution program, and how MCS will continue to comply with the executive order to provide education during this time. We will get through this together! #InThisTogetherOhio #WeRPrexies #PrexieProud

*** Update Wednesday, March 18, 2020 ***

â€” MCS buildings will not be open to the public after noon on Thursday, March 19. Anyone needing access to any district building should call prior to arrival between 8:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. This does not apply to those families who are picking up student packets.
â€” The home paper option packets will be available for pick up at the buildings from 8:00 a.m. until noon tomorrow, March 19. More copies have been made for each grade level.
â€” If you have a middle school or high school student, please bring your student with you or discuss their class schedule prior to picking up their assignment packet. Please only take packets that apply to your student.
â€” Please be aware that teachers and staff may be attempting to reach you by phone. If you receive a call from a number you don't know or a blocked number, please answer, because it may be your child's teacher.

post_text: The health and safety of all students, staff, and the community are of the utmost importance to us. We would like to take a moment and share with you how Marion City Schools is responding to the subject of Coronavirus (COVID-19). We are working closely with Marion Public Health to monitor the situation and to develop a coordinated and comprehensive public health plan to ensure we are prepared if cases arise in our community. Leaders from Marion Public Health, OhioHealth, and all county school districts will be meeting tomorrow, March 11, to discuss additional organized efforts in greater detail. For more information on preventative measures and links to resources for our families and community, visit â†ªï¸ https://www.marioncityschools.org/student-services/health-services. #WeRPrexies
